item.title: Oil Holds at 10-Month High on Supply Worries
item.description: Oil prices held steady at a roughly 10-month high as investors continued to worry about supply cuts tightening the market.

item.title: Gilts Look Attractive Ahead of 10-Year Auction, Says RBC Capital Markets
item.description: Gilts are starting to look “very interesting” cross market, RBC Capital Markets said ahead of the £3.75 billion tap of the 3.25% January 2033 gilt on Wednesday.

item.title: UK Economy Shrinks More Than Expected
item.description: The U.K.’s GDP fell 0.5% in July, suggesting activity is cooling in the face of monetary tightening by the Bank of England.

item.title: Dollar Trade Could Be Volatile After Mixed US Inflation Data
item.description: The U.S. inflation data could cause volatility in the dollar if, as expected, it gives a mixed picture with headline inflation rising but core inflation falling, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: Tullow Oil Narrows Production View
item.description: Tullow Oil posted a sharp fall in first-half profits and forecast slightly lower full-year output of 58,000-60,000 barrels a day, due to its Jubilee field underperforming.

item.title: Old Mutual Sees Jump in Underlying Earnings
item.description: Old Mutual said it expected first-half adjusted headline earnings to be 20% higher on year, as higher interest rates and a recovery in equity markets helped investment returns, but headline profits would be sharply lower.

item.title: India Keeps Pulling the Plug on Its Digital Economy
item.description: India’s government leads the world in internet shutdowns, cutting off access more than all other nations combined.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.2%, Dragged by Electronics Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in electronics stocks, as caution continues over the Fed’s further tightening.

item.title: Inditex Boosted by Sales Push
item.description: Inditex reported first-half underlying earnings of €4.7 billion on above-forecast sales and said it continued to expect a stable gross margin plus or minus 50 basis points for the year.

item.title: Kim Jong Un and Vladimir Putin Meet at Russia's Vostochny Cosmodrome
item.description: Vladimir Putin welcomed North Korea’s Kim Jong Un at Russia’s main spaceport.

item.title: Alibaba Introduces AI Model to Public
item.description: Alibaba has launched its artificial-intelligence model, making it the latest Chinese company to tap the country’s fast-growing AI market.

item.title: Russian Navy Shipyard Targeted by Missile Strikes in Sevastopol, Two Vessels Hit
item.description: The attack seemed to be one of the biggest yet, with footage posted by witnesses showing giant fireballs rising in the area and powerful blasts blowing out windows.

item.title: Hedge Funds' Big Bet Against Treasurys Isn't What You Think
item.description: Inflation, bond issuance and Fed tightening are spurring a Treasury derivative bonanza.

item.title: An advisory panel to the FDA said an ingredient in widely used oraldecongestants doesn't work, setting the stage for dozens of products to be removed from U.S. store shelves.
item.description: An advisory panel to the FDA said an ingredient in widely used oral decongestants doesn’t work, setting the stage for dozens of products to be removed from U.S. store shelves.

item.title: The UAW plans to hold targeted strikes at certain U.S. auto factories if it can't reach new labor deals with Detroit by late Thursday, a move that could disrupt assembly-line production.
item.description: The UAW plans to hold targeted strikes at certain U.S. auto factories if it can’t reach new labor deals with Detroit by late Thursday, a move that could disrupt assembly-line production.

item.title: Technology stocks helped pull down the S&P 500 by 0.6%, while the Nasdaq and Dow industrials declined 1% and 0.1%, respectively.
item.description: Technology stocks helped pull down the S&P 500 by 0.6%, while the Nasdaq and Dow industrials declined 1% and 0.1%, respectively.

item.title: A Chinese aircraft carrier and around two dozen other Chinese warships were gathering in the western Pacific, according to authorities in Taiwan and Japan, an unusually large group suggesting Beijing may be planning major naval exercises.
item.description: A Chinese aircraft carrier and around two dozen other Chinese warships were gathering in the western Pacific, according to authorities in Taiwan and Japan, an unusually large group suggesting Beijing may be planning major naval exercises.

item.title: Apple unveiled a new iPhone lineup aimed at wringing more money out of its top model without jacking up prices for more basic versions that are getting only minor upgrades.
item.description: Apple unveiled a new iPhone lineup aimed at wringing more money out of its top model without jacking up prices for more basic versions that are getting only minor upgrades.

item.title: BP Chief Executive Bernard Looney resigned abruptly over past relationships with colleagues, the oil giant said.
item.description: BP Chief Executive Bernard Looney resigned abruptly over past relationships with colleagues, the oil giant said.

item.title: Ireland's Smurfit Kappa agreed to acquire U.S. peer WestRock for $11.15 billion, in a deal that would create a paper and packaging powerhouse.
item.description: Ireland’s Smurfit Kappa agreed to acquire U.S. peer WestRock for $11.15 billion, in a deal that would create a paper and packaging powerhouse.
